meanings.sent1: The fringier curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: Her fringier scarf kept her warm in the chilly weather.
meanings.sent3: The fringier lampshade made the room look like a fancy hotel.
meanings.sent4: The fringier edges of the painting gave it a unique and artistic touch.
meanings.sent5: The fringier details of the dress made it stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: More fringe-like or on the fringe.
meanings.sent1: The fringe on her bag was fringier than on any other bag.
meanings.sent2: The fringier decorations at the party made it more festive.
meanings.sent3: His fringier hairstyle made him look like a rockstar.
meanings.sent4: The fringier music genre was gaining popularity among the youth.
meanings.sent5: The fringier art exhibit showcased avant-garde pieces.

meanings.definition: Tending to be on the edge or periphery.
meanings.sent1: Her fringier social circle included artists and musicians.
meanings.sent2: Living in a fringier neighborhood allowed them to enjoy peace and quiet.
meanings.sent3: The fringier topics in the conversation made it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: His fringier interests led him to explore unconventional hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The fringier events in town attracted a niche audience.
